alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jackson; Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 19 at 1:52PM CDT until August 20 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT SUNDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 105 expected. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 110 possible. * WHERE...In Iowa, Benton, Linn, Jones and Jackson Counties. In Illinois, Carroll County. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Sunday. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Sunday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The excessive heat watch will likely roll over into a prolonged advisory or warning after Monday night.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
